intro: Dessenia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy dessenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savannah habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
